column5: SELECT tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName AS [Customer Name], tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum AS [Cust Number], tblAcctSpecial.OnBoardDate, tblAcctSpecial.ServLevel AS [Service Level] FROM tblAcctSpecial GROUP BY tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName, tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum, tblAcctSpecial.OnBoardDate, tblAcctSpecial.ServLevel ORDER BY tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName;

SELECT tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum AS [Cust Number], tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName AS [Customer Name], tblAcctSpecial.OnBoardDate, tblAcctSpecial.ServLevel AS [Service Level] FROM tblAcctSpecial GROUP BY tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum, tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName, tblAcctSpecial.OnBoardDate, tblAcctSpecial.ServLevel ORDER BY tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum;

SELECT tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum AS [Policy Num], tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum AS [Cust Number], tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName AS [Customer Name], tblAcctSpecial.OnBoardDate, tblAcctSpecial.ServLevel AS [Service Level] FROM tblPOLICIES INNER JOIN tblAcctSpecial ON tblPOLICIES.CustomerNum=tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum GROUP BY tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum, tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum, tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName, tblAcctSpecial.OnBoardDate, tblAcctSpecial.ServLevel HAVING (((tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum) Is Not Null)) ORDER BY tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum;

SELECT tblPolicies.AgentCode AS [Producer Code], tblPolicies.AgentName AS Producer, tblPolicies.AccountName AS [Customer Name], tblPolicies.InceptDate AS Inception, tblPolicies.CustomerNum FROM tblPolicies GROUP BY tblPolicies.AgentCode, tblPolicies.AgentName, tblPolicies.AccountName, tblPolicies.InceptDate, tblPolicies.CustomerNum HAVING (((tblPolicies.AgentCode) Is Not Null)) ORDER BY tblPolicies.AgentCode;
SELECT tblAcctAffinityProgram.ProgramName AS [Affinity Program Name], tblAcctAffinityProgram.OnBoardDt AS [On Board Date] FROM tblAcctAffinityProgram ORDER BY tblAcctAffinityProgram.ProgramName;

SELECT tblPolicies.AcctOnPolicyName AS [Named Insured on Policy], tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName AS [Customer Name], tblAcctSpecial.AcctOwner AS [Account Owner], tblPolicies.CustomerNum FROM tblPolicies INNER JOIN tblAcctSpecial ON tblPolicies.CustomerNum = tblAcctSpecial.CustomerNum GROUP BY tblPolicies.AcctOnPolicyName, tblAcctSpecial.CustomerName, tblAcctSpecial.AcctOwner, tblPolicies.CustomerNum HAVING (((tblPolicies.AcctOnPolicyName) Is Not Null)) ORDER BY tblPolicies.AcctOnPolicyName;

column13:
The Proceed button decides where the user should go next based on whether the work is:

Non?Affinity business, or
Affinity business

It also prevents users from proceeding unless they have made the required selection first.

Step 1: Check the business type (optAffinAcct)
The logic starts by checking the value of optAffinAcct:

optAffinAcct = 2 ? This means NOT Affinity Business
Any other value ? This means Affinity Business

This option determines which workflow and form will be opened next.

Step 2: Non?Affinity Business path (optAffinAcct = 2)
Validation check
Before moving forward, the code checks whether the user selected any account information by verifying these controls:

cboAcctName
cboCustNum
cboPolicy
cboAffiliate
cboProducer
cboNamedInsured

If all of these are Null, then:

A message box appears saying:
“You have made an account selection yet. Please go back and select an account.”
Message type: Information
Title: Selection Required
The procedure stops immediately (Exit Sub)

Successful validation
If at least one of those fields has a value:

The form frmAccountParent_CCT is opened
This moves the user into the non?affinity account workflow


Step 3: Affinity Business path (Else branch)
Validation check
For affinity business, the required selections are program?based, so the code checks:

cboAffinName
cboAffinCode

If both are Null:

A message box appears saying:
“You have made an program selection yet. Please go back and select a program.”
Message type: Information
Title: Selection Required
The procedure stops immediately

Successful validation
If either field has a value:

The form frmAffinityParent_CCT is opened
This moves the user into the affinity program workflow


Final outcome in simple terms

The button routes the user to the correct next screen based on business type.
It enforces required selections so users can’t proceed without choosing:

An Account (for non?affinity), or
A Program (for affinity).


It prevents blank or accidental workflow progression.

column3: Please enter this claim as you normally would:
(There will not be a PMS Unit noted by CCT at this time)

This is an HCM or Location Coded Only Account.  There is very little account information and sometimes no Insured and/or Agent contact information in the database.  The SHI will be different than you’d normally see.  Please to attach to your claim.  Please mark your claim as Special following your policy instructions and fill out the SAC Tab (including Account Location Identifier, if applicable).
Click on a Policy Below to View details:
column5: SELECT tblPOLICIES.AcctOnPolicyName AS [Name On Policy], tblPOLICIES.PolPref AS Prefix, tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum AS PolicyNum, tblPOLICIES.PolMod AS Mod, tblPOLICIES.InceptDate, tblPOLICIES.ExpDate AS ExpireDate, tblPOLICIES.PolicyType, tblPOLICIES.PolicyStatus FROM tblPOLICIES WHERE (((tblPOLICIES.CustomerNum)=Forms!frmAccountParent_CCT!bxCustNum)) ORDER BY tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum, tblPOLICIES.PolMod DESC;

SELECT tblPolicies.PolicyStatus FROM tblPolicies GROUP BY tblPolicies.PolicyStatus, tblPolicies.CustomerNum HAVING (((tblPolicies.CustomerNum)=[Forms]![frmSpecAcctPolicies_CCT]![Text9])) ORDER BY tblPolicies.PolicyStatus;
column16: After find Policy is udpate by selecting the dropdown the bxdisplayPolicy List box is update with the new values, search based on the query - "SELECT tblPOLICIES.AcctOnPolicyName AS [Name On Policy], tblPOLICIES.PolPref AS Sym, tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum AS PolNum, tblPOLICIES.PolMod AS Mod, tblPOLICIES.InceptDate, tblPOLICIES.ExpDate AS Expires, tblPOLICIES.PolicyType, tblPOLICIES.PolicyStatus FROM tblPOLICIES WHERE (((tblPOLICIES.PolicyStatus) = [Forms]![frmSpecAcctPolicies_CCT]![bxFindStatus]) And ((tblPOLICIES.CustomerNum) = [Forms]![frmSpecAcctPolicies_CCT]![Text9]))ORDER BY tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum, tblPOLICIES.PolMod DESC;"

column5: SELECT tblPolicies.PolicyNum FROM tblPolicies GROUP BY tblPolicies.PolicyNum, tblPolicies.CustomerNum HAVING (((tblPolicies.CustomerNum)=[Forms]![frmSpecAcctPolicies_CCT]![Text9])) ORDER BY tblPolicies.PolicyNum;
column16: After find Policy is udpate by selecting the dropdown the bxdisplayPolicy List box is update with the new values, search based on the query - "ctOnPolicyName AS [Name On Policy], tblPOLICIES.PolPref AS Sym, tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum AS PolNum, tblPOLICIES.PolMod AS Mod, tblPOLICIES.InceptDate, tblPOLICIES.ExpDate AS Expires, tblPOLICIES.PolicyType, tblPOLICIES.PolicyStatus FROM tblPOLICIES WHERE (((tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum) = [Forms]![frmSpecAcctPolicies_CCT]![bxFindPolicy]) And ((tblPOLICIES.CustomerNum) = [Forms]![frmSpecAcctPolicies_CCT]![Text9]))ORDER BY tblPOLICIES.PolicyNum, tblPOLICIES.PolMod DESC;"
